_prev_prog_3.PC_OtherType: Fill shut-off device at 85%, ESD at 90%, Class 1, Div. 1 electrical from transfer point to 5 ft. Class 1, Div. 2 from 5-15 ft., labels on cylinders (NFPA 704, Not Odorized, No Smoking, etc.)
_prev_prog_3.MS_OtherType: Portable 20 lb. fire extinguishers and hydrants.  Excess flow valves, pressure/hydrostatic relief valves.  Thermal actuated valves.
_prev_prog_3.EquipmentTested: Vessels, pipes, emergency shut-down systems, signage, grounding/bonding
_prev_prog_3.Description: Level III:  Butane (liquefied butane under pressure) blending system involving direct injection into refined product (gasoline) pipelines with bulk truck off-loading.

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
The Buckeye Terminals, LLC - Rockford Terminal Butane Blending System was constructed in accordance with the National Fire Protection Association Code #58 (2014 Edition) for Liquefied Petroleum Gas Storage, and it is the Facility's policy to follow the most current future editions to the extent feasible and adhere to all applicable Federal, State, and Local codes/laws. If an emergency were to occur, it is the Facility's policy to contact the Win-Bur-Sew Fire Protection District and the Winnebago County Emergency Services Disaster Agency, as appropriate, through the 911 Service. Medical emergencies will require notification of Rock River Emergency Medical Services (critical care provided by REACT transport helicopter). The primary hospital response is provided through Rockford Memorial Hospital (also the nearest Level 1 Trauma Center). The Facility currently maintains a trained incipient stage fire response and first responder-operations level hazardous materials response team to respond to the initial stages of an emergency.



The Buckeye Terminals, LLC - Rockford Terminal Butane Blending System is a refined product storage and truck distribution facility, including the butane blending system (direct injection into the gasoline load rack). The Risk Management Plan covers the butane blending system including two horizontal storage vessels, the associated piping, one injection skid, two sample analyzers along with gasoline fast loops, and one truck offloading point.



The Worst Case and Alternate Case release scenarios were evaluated and communicated to the Win-Bur-Sew Fire Protection District.  Additionally, the local Emergency Response Action Plan was updated to reflect the addition of butane.



The Buckeye Terminals, LLC - Rockford Terminal Butane Blending System complies with the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency's Accident Prevention Rules (40 CFR Part 68 Subpart D- Program Level 3).  Additionally, this plan meets the requirements of the U.S. Department of

Labor- Occupational Safety and Health Administration's Process Safety Management regulations (inclusive of all 14 elements) for Highly Hazardous Chemicals (29 CFR Part 1910.119).



This Facility has never had an accident or incident involving the butane blending system resulting in deaths, injuries, property/environmental damage, evacuations, or sheltering-in-place.



In the event of an emergency involving the Rockford Terminal butane blending system, it is the policy of the Facility to initially contact the Win-Bur-Sew Fire Protection District and request their assistance. The Facility's Emergency Response Action Plan is coordinated with the Win-Bur-Sew Fire Protection District and the Winnebago County Emergency Services Disaster Agency.  The Win-Bur-Sew Fire Protection District is aware of the Facility's butane blending system, its safety systems, access points, and protective procedures in the event of a significant release. The Terminal is fully secured with fencing and controlled access in accordance with its site security plan.



Buckeye continually evaluates the process for opportunities to improve safety. Also, Buckeye is implementing a corporate-wide policy to include the local first responders in regular exercises and in all 3 year PSM/RMP training cycles.
